message.content:
Explore the guides system in looksmaxx-app. I need to understand:

1. All current guide files in `src/data/guides/` - list each guide, its topic, sections, and products referenced
2. The guide types in `src/types/guides.ts`
3. How guides link to products (the product callout system)

Focus on: What topics are covered, what's missing, and how products are integrated into guides.

Return a summary of:
- All 9 guides with their topics and product references
- Any gaps in coverage based on the guide categories
- How the affiliate product integration works

content.text: I'll explore the guides system comprehensively for you. Let me start by examining the structure and files.
Now let me read the products registry to see all products:

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Product Registry for Guides System
     3â†’ * 33 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
     4â†’ */
     5â†’
     6â†’import { GuideProduct, ProductCategory } from '@/types/guides';
     7â†’import { buildAmazonUrl } from '@/lib/region';
     8â†’
     9â†’// ============================================
    10â†’// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
    11â†’// ============================================
    12â†’
    13â†’interface ProductASINs {
    14â†’  us?: string;
    15â†’  uk?: string;
    16â†’  de?: string;
    17â†’  fr?: string;
    18â†’  au?: string;
    19â†’}
    20â†’
    21â†’// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
    22â†’type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
    23â†’const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];
    24â†’
    25â†’// Helper to build region links from ASINs
    26â†’function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
    27â†’  const links: Record<string, string> = {};
    28â†’
    29â†’  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    30â†’    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    31â†’    if (asin) {
    32â†’      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    33â†’    }
    34â†’  });
    35â†’
    36â†’  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
    37â†’  if (asins.us) {
    38â†’    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
    39â†’  }
    40â†’
    41â†’  return links;
    42â†’}

   702â†’  return categories.map(category => ({

   705â†’  }));
   706â†’}
   707â†’
   708â†’/**

   710â†’ */
   711â†’export function getGuideProductsByIds(ids: string[]): GuideProduct[] {
   712â†’  return ids
   713â†’    .map(id => getGuideProductById(id))

   716â†’
   717â†’/**

   720â†’export function searchGuideProducts(query: string): GuideProduct[] {

   722â†’  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p =>

   724â†’    p.description.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
   725â†’    p.tagline.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
   726â†’    (p.brand && p.brand.toLowerCase().includes(lowered))
   727â†’  );
   728â†’}

/**
 * Product Registry for Guides System
 * 33 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
 */

import { GuideProduct, ProductCategory } from '@/types/guides';
import { buildAmazonUrl } from '@/lib/region';

// ============================================
// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
// ============================================

interface ProductASINs {
  us?: string;
  uk?: string;
  de?: string;
  fr?: string;
  au?: string;
}

// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];

// Helper to build region links from ASINs
function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
  const links: Record<string, string> = {};

  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    if (asin) {
      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    }
  });

  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
  if (asins.us) {
    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
  }

  return links;
}

// PRODUCT DATABASE (33 Products)

// ============================================
// HELPER FUNCTIONS
// ============================================

/**
 * Get product by ID
 */
export function getGuideProductById(id: string): GuideProduct | undefined {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.find(p => p.id === id);
}

/**
 * Get all products in a category
 */
export function getGuideProductsByCategory(category: ProductCategory): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.category === category)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get all base stack products (essentials for everyone)
 */
export function getBaseStackProducts(): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.isBaseStack)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get products by priority level
 */
export function getGuideProductsByPriority(priority: number): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.priority === priority);
}

/**
 * Get all unique categories with product counts
 */
export function getProductCategories(): Array<{ category: ProductCategory; count: number }> {
  const categories: ProductCategory[] = ['hygiene', 'grooming', 'skincare', 'miscellaneous', 'supplements'];

  return categories.map(category => ({
    category,
    count: GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.category === category).length,
  }));
}

/**
 * Get products by array of IDs (preserves order)
 */
export function getGuideProductsByIds(ids: string[]): GuideProduct[] {
  return ids
    .map(id => getGuideProductById(id))
    .filter((p): p is GuideProduct => p !== undefined);
}

/**
 * Search products by name or description
 */
export function searchGuideProducts(query: string): GuideProduct[] {
  const lowered = query.toLowerCase();
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p =>
    p.name.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.description.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.tagline.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    (p.brand && p.brand.toLowerCase().includes(lowered))
  );
}

/**
 * Get total product count
 */
export function getTotalProductCount(): number {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.length;
}

/**
 * Get category display info
 */
export function getCategoryDisplayInfo(category: ProductCategory): {
  name: string;
  icon: string;
  description: string;
} {
  const info: Record<ProductCategory, { name: string; icon: string; description: string }> = {
    hygiene: {
      name: 'Hygiene',
      icon: 'Sparkles',
      description: 'Fundamentals of not repelling people',
    },
    grooming: {
      name: 'Grooming',
      icon: 'Scissors',
      description: 'Tools for precision face maintenance',
    },
    skincare: {
      name: 'Skincare',
      icon: 'Droplet',
      description: 'Your skin is your face. Treat it right.',
    },
    miscellaneous: {
      name: 'Miscellaneous',
      icon: 'Package',
      description: 'The supporting cast of your glow-up',
    },
    supplements: {
      name: 'Supplements',
      icon: 'Pill',
      description: 'Fill the gaps your diet is missing',
    },
  };

  return info[category];
}

content.content:
1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Mindset & Beginner Mistakes Guide
     3â†’ * Humor Level: High (30%)
     4â†’ */
     5â†’
     6â†’import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';
     7â†’
     8â†’export const mindsetGuide: Guide = {
     9â†’  id: 'mindset',
    10â†’  slug: 'mindset-mistakes',
    11â†’  title: 'Mindset & Beginner Mistakes',
    12â†’  subtitle: "The cope stops here",
    13â†’  description: "Before you spend a dime, fix the mental game. Most guys sabotage themselves before they even start.",
    14â†’  icon: 'Brain',
    15â†’  humorLevel: 'high',
    16â†’  estimatedReadTime: 8,
    17â†’  order: 1,
    18â†’  tags: ['mindset', 'beginners', 'fundamentals'],
    19â†’  relatedGuides: ['maintenance', 'body-fat'],
    20â†’  productIds: [],
    21â†’  forumCategory: 'anxiety',
    22â†’  heroMedia: {
    23â†’    id: 'mindset-hero',
    24â†’    type: 'image',
    25â†’    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1507003211169-0a1dd7228f2d?w=1200&q=80',
    26â†’    alt: 'Focused mindset and determination',
    27â†’    placement: 'hero',
    28â†’  },
    29â†’  sections: [
    30â†’    {
    31â†’      id: 'intro',
    32â†’      title: 'The Real Talk',
    33â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
    34â†’      content: `You're here because you want to look better. Good. That's the first step.
    35â†’
    36â†’But here's what nobody tells you: **most guys fail not because they don't know what to do, but because their mindset is cooked from day one.**
    37â†’
    38â†’They're either:
    39â†’- Paralyzed by analysis (reading guides instead of taking action)
    40â†’- Expecting overnight results (then quitting after 2 weeks)
    41â†’- Comparing themselves to genetic outliers (and feeling defeated)
    42â†’- Looking for shortcuts (spoiler: there aren't any)
    43â†’
    44â†’This guide is about fixing that before you waste months spinning your wheels.`,
    45â†’      media: [
    46â†’        {
    47â†’          id: 'mindset-intro',
    48â†’          type: 'image',
    49â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1552674605-db6ffd4facb5?w=800&q=80',
    50â†’          alt: 'Man focused on goals',
    51â†’          caption: 'The mindset game starts before everything else',
    52â†’          placement: 'inline',
    53â†’        },
    54â†’      ],
    55â†’    },
    56â†’    {
    57â†’      id: 'mistake-1-perfectionism',
    58â†’      title: 'Mistake #1: Waiting for the "Perfect" Plan',
    59â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
    60â†’      content: `You've bookmarked 47 articles. You've saved 200 Instagram posts. You've downloaded 12 PDFs. You've done exactly **zero** actual work.
    61â†’
    62â†’**This ain't it, chief.**
    63â†’
    64â†’The perfect routine doesn't exist. There's no secret combination of products and exercises that will unlock chad-tier genetics. There's just consistent effort over time.
    65â†’
    66â†’Here's the brutal truth: a mediocre plan executed consistently beats a perfect plan you never start.
    67â†’
    68â†’**Action Step:** Pick ONE thing from this app to improve. Just one. Do it for 30 days before adding anything else.`,
    69â†’      tips: [
    70â†’        'Done is better than perfect',
    71â†’        'Consistency beats intensity every single time',
    72â†’        'Start before you feel ready'
    73â†’      ],
    74â†’      media: [
    75â†’        {
    76â†’          id: 'perfectionism-trap',
    77â†’          type: 'image',
    78â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1484480974693-6ca0a78fb36b?w=800&q=80',
    79â†’          alt: 'Planning and action',
    80â†’          caption: 'Stop planning, start doing',
    81â†’          placement: 'inline',
    82â†’        },
    83â†’      ],
    84â†’    },
    85â†’    {
    86â†’      id: 'mistake-2-timeline',
    87â†’      title: 'Mistake #2: Expecting Fast Results',
    88â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',

/**
 * Mindset & Beginner Mistakes Guide
 * Humor Level: High (30%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const mindsetGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'mindset',
  slug: 'mindset-mistakes',
  title: 'Mindset & Beginner Mistakes',
  subtitle: "The cope stops here",
  description: "Before you spend a dime, fix the mental game. Most guys sabotage themselves before they even start.",
  icon: 'Brain',
  humorLevel: 'high',
  estimatedReadTime: 8,
  order: 1,
  tags: ['mindset', 'beginners', 'fundamentals'],
  relatedGuides: ['maintenance', 'body-fat'],
  productIds: [],
  forumCategory: 'anxiety',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'mindset-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1507003211169-0a1dd7228f2d?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Focused mindset and determination',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Real Talk',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `You're here because you want to look better. Good. That's the first step.

But here's what nobody tells you: **most guys fail not because they don't know what to do, but because their mindset is cooked from day one.**

They're either:
- Paralyzed by analysis (reading guides instead of taking action)
- Expecting overnight results (then quitting after 2 weeks)
- Comparing themselves to genetic outliers (and feeling defeated)
- Looking for shortcuts (spoiler: there aren't any)

This guide is about fixing that before you waste months spinning your wheels.`,
      media: [
        {
          id: 'mindset-intro',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1552674605-db6ffd4facb5?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Man focused on goals',
          caption: 'The mindset game starts before everything else',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-1-perfectionism',
      title: 'Mistake #1: Waiting for the "Perfect" Plan',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `You've bookmarked 47 articles. You've saved 200 Instagram posts. You've downloaded 12 PDFs. You've done exactly **zero** actual work.

**This ain't it, chief.**

The perfect routine doesn't exist. There's no secret combination of products and exercises that will unlock chad-tier genetics. There's just consistent effort over time.

Here's the brutal truth: a mediocre plan executed consistently beats a perfect plan you never start.

**Action Step:** Pick ONE thing from this app to improve. Just one. Do it for 30 days before adding anything else.`,
      tips: [
        'Done is better than perfect',
        'Consistency beats intensity every single time',
        'Start before you feel ready'
      ],
      media: [
        {
          id: 'perfectionism-trap',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1484480974693-6ca0a78fb36b?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Planning and action',
          caption: 'Stop planning, start doing',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-2-timeline',
      title: 'Mistake #2: Expecting Fast Results',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `You started mewing yesterday and you're checking your jawline in the mirror this morning. Bro.

Real change takes **months to years**, depending on what you're working on:

| Change | Timeline |
|--------|----------|
| Better skin (routine) | 6-12 weeks |
| Body recomposition | 3-6 months |
| Posture improvement | 3-6 months |
| Hair regrowth (minox) | 6-12 months |
| Mewing (adults) | 1-2+ years |

**The guys who win are the ones who forget about results and just lock in on the process.**

Think about it: if you had started 6 months ago, you'd already be there. You didn't. So start now and stop checking daily.`,
      warnings: [
        'Taking progress photos daily will drive you insane',
        'Monthly or bi-monthly comparison photos are enough'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-3-comparison',
      title: 'Mistake #3: Comparing to Genetic Outliers',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `You're comparing yourself to guys who:
- Won the genetic lottery
- Have professional lighting in every photo
- Are on gear and won't admit it
- Use filters/editing
- Got surgery and claim "just mewing bro"

**This is NPC behavior.**

Here's a better frame: you're not trying to become someone else. You're trying to mog your past self. That's it.

Your only competition is the guy you were 6 months ago. If he'd be jealous of where you are now, you're winning.`,
      tips: [
        'Mog your past self, not strangers on the internet',
        'Unfollow accounts that make you feel like garbage',
        'Follow for information, not comparison'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-4-shortcuts',
      title: 'Mistake #4: Looking for Shortcuts',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `There are no shortcuts. There are no hacks. There is no "one weird trick."

The internet is full of people trying to sell you things you don't need:
- Miracle supplements that do nothing
- Expensive gadgets that collect dust
- "Secret" techniques that are just repackaged basics

**Here's what actually works:**
1. Sleep 7-9 hours
2. Eat enough protein
3. Lift weights
4. Use sunscreen
5. Stay lean
6. Groom yourself

That's 90% of it. Everything else is optimization on top of this foundation. If you're not doing these six things consistently, nothing else matters.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-5-all-or-nothing',
      title: 'Mistake #5: All-or-Nothing Thinking',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `You miss one gym session and think "welp, the whole week is ruined."
You eat one bad meal and say "might as well order pizza for the rest of the week."
You skip your skincare once and abandon the routine entirely.

**This is self-sabotage with extra steps.**

Progress isn't linear. Life happens. The goal isn't perfectionâ€”it's **consistency over time**.

Missing one day means nothing. Missing one day, then letting it spiral into one week, then one month? That's the killer.

**The rule:** If you miss, just get back on track the next opportunity. No guilt, no drama. Just reset and continue.`,
      tips: [
        'One bad day is noise. One bad month is a pattern.',
        "Never miss twice in a rowâ€”that's the real rule",
        'Lower the bar if needed, but show up'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-6-money-before-basics',
      title: 'Mistake #6: Spending Money Before Basics',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `You're researching jaw implants but you're at 22% body fat.
You want Botox but you've never worn sunscreen.
You're considering hair transplants but you sleep 5 hours a night.

**You're skipping chapters, my guy.**

Here's the priority order:
1. **Free tier:** Sleep, hydration, basic hygiene, mewing, posture
2. **Low cost ($20-50/mo):** Gym, skincare basics, grooming tools
3. **Medium cost ($50-200/mo):** Supplements, better products, minoxidil
4. **High cost ($500+):** Treatments, procedures, surgery

Don't level skip. The expensive stuff doesn't work if the foundation is garbage.

Surgery on a 25% body fat face is like putting a spoiler on a Honda Civic. Fix the car first.`,
      warnings: [
        "Surgery doesn't fix lifestyle problems",
        'Get to 12% body fat before considering facial procedures'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'the-real-strategy',
      title: 'The Actual Strategy That Works',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Here's what the successful guys do:

**1. Accept the timeline**
You're playing a 1-2 year game minimum. Accept that now or quit.

**2. Build systems, not goals**
"I want a better jawline" is a goal. "I chew mastic gum for 20 minutes after every meal" is a system. Systems win.

**3. Track ruthlessly**
Take monthly photos. Same lighting, same angle, same expression. This is the only objective measure.

**4. Iterate slowly**
Add one new thing every 4-6 weeks. Not five things at once. You need to know what's actually working.

**5. Focus on the 80/20**
20% of actions produce 80% of results. For most guys:
- Getting lean (diet + exercise)
- Skincare (cleanser, moisturizer, sunscreen)
- Grooming (hair, brows, facial hair)

**Nail these before anything else.**`,
      tips: [
        'Progress compounds over time',
        'Small daily actions beat occasional big efforts',
        'Document everything so you can see the change'
      ],
      media: [
        {
          id: 'strategy-visual',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1434596922112-19c563067271?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Progress and tracking',
          caption: 'Track ruthlessly, iterate slowly',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'closing',
      title: 'Lock In',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `The cope stops here. No more excuses. No more "I'll start Monday." No more blaming genetics.

You have all the information you need. This app, this guide, these toolsâ€”they're more than enough.

The only question is whether you're actually going to do the work or just read about it and go back to whatever you were doing before.

**Your move.**

Mog your past self. That's the whole game.`,
    },
  ],
};

1â†’/**

     6â†’import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';
     7â†’
     8â†’export const maintenanceGuide: Guide = {
     9â†’  id: 'maintenance',
    10â†’  slug: 'general-maintenance',
    11â†’  title: 'General Maintenance',
    12â†’  subtitle: "The bare minimum that most guys still somehow miss",
    13â†’  description: "Daily and weekly grooming habits that separate you from the NPCs. Non-negotiable baseline stuff.",
    14â†’  icon: 'Wrench',
    15â†’  humorLevel: 'high',
    16â†’  estimatedReadTime: 10,
    17â†’  order: 2,
    18â†’  tags: ['grooming', 'hygiene', 'daily-routine', 'fundamentals'],
    19â†’  relatedGuides: ['mindset', 'skincare'],
    20â†’  productIds: [
    21â†’    'tongue_scraper',
    22â†’    'electric_toothbrush',
    23â†’    'philips_oneblade',
    24â†’    'nose_trimmer',
    25â†’    'tweezers',
    26â†’    'aquaphor_lip',
    27â†’    'cologne_bleu',
    28â†’  ],
    29â†’  forumCategory: 'fashion',
    30â†’  heroMedia: {
    31â†’    id: 'maintenance-hero',
    32â†’    type: 'image',
    33â†’    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1519085360753-af0119f7cbe7?w=1200&q=80',
    34â†’    alt: 'Clean, well-groomed appearance',
    35â†’    placement: 'hero',
    36â†’  },
    37â†’  sections: [
    38â†’    {
    39â†’      id: 'intro',
    40â†’      title: 'The NPC Baseline',
    41â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
    42â†’      content: `Here's something that might hurt: most guys walking around have absolutely no idea how many basic maintenance things they're neglecting.
    43â†’
    44â†’Nostril tentacles waving at people mid-conversation. Crusty lips. Unibrow situation developing. Breath that could clear a room.
    45â†’
    46â†’**Nobody tells you this stuff.** Your friends won't. Your family's given up. Tinder matches just unmatch without explanation.
    47â†’
    48â†’This guide is the checklist. The bare minimum. The "if you're not doing this, nothing else matters" baseline.
    49â†’
    50â†’Everything here is simple. Nothing is expensive. No excuses.`,
    51â†’    },
    52â†’    {
    53â†’      id: 'daily-oral',
    54â†’      title: 'Daily: Oral Hygiene',
    55â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
    56â†’      content: `Your breath is out here committing war crimes and you don't even know it.
    57â†’
    58â†’**The Protocol:**
    59â†’1. **Brush 2x daily** â€” Electric toothbrush, 2 minutes minimum. If you're using a manual toothbrush in 2024, that's NPC behavior.
    60â†’2. **Floss daily** â€” Yes, actually. The stuff between your teeth is rotting. Get string floss or a water flosser.
    61â†’3. **Tongue scrape** â€” This is the secret weapon. 70% of bad breath comes from bacteria on your tongue. Takes 10 seconds, changes everything.
    62â†’
    63â†’**The Reality Check:**
    64â†’- You can't smell your own breath
    65â†’- Everyone's too polite to tell you
    66â†’- This is actively limiting your social and romantic life
    67â†’- Fix it now`,
    68â†’      products: ['tongue_scraper', 'electric_toothbrush'],
    69â†’      tips: [
    70â†’        'Scrape tongue BEFORE brushing, not after',
    71â†’        'Replace toothbrush head every 3 months',
    72â†’        'Mouthwash is optional but flossing is mandatory'
    73â†’      ],
    74â†’      media: [
    75â†’        {
    76â†’          id: 'tongue-scraping',
    77â†’          type: 'image',
    78â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1606107557195-0e29a4b5b4aa?w=800&q=80',
    79â†’          alt: 'Oral hygiene and dental care products',
    80â†’          caption: 'Oral hygiene: brush, floss, scrape',
    81â†’          placement: 'inline',
    82â†’        },
    83â†’      ],
    84â†’    },
    85â†’    {
    86â†’      id: 'daily-lips',
    87â†’      title: 'Daily: Lip Care',
    88â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
    89â†’      content: `Crusty, chapped lips are sabotaging your entire face. The fix costs $5.
    90â†’
    91â†’**Why This Matters:**
    92â†’Your lips are one of the first things people notice. Dry, cracked lips read as "doesn't take care of himself" instantly.
    93â†’
    94â†’**The Fix:**
    95â†’- Apply lip balm or Aquaphor morning and night
    96â†’- Reapply after eating or drinking
    97â†’- At night, use a heavier occlusive (Aquaphor > chapstick)
    98â†’
    99â†’**Common Mistakes:**
   100â†’- Licking your lips (makes it worse)
   101â†’- Flavored lip balms (you'll lick them)
   102â†’- Forgetting entirely (check your lips right now)
   103â†’
   104â†’**Pro tip:** Keep one by your bed, one in your pocket, one at your desk. The best lip balm is the one you actually use.`,
   105â†’      products: ['aquaphor_lip'],
   106â†’    },
   107â†’    {
   108â†’      id: 'weekly-nose-ear',
   109â†’      title: 'Weekly: Nose & Ear Hair',
   110â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
   111â†’      content: `Nostril tentacles waving at people mid-conversation is an instant mog-killer. Nobody's going to tell youâ€”they'll just slowly lose attraction and not know why.
   112â†’
   113â†’**The Protocol:**
   114â†’- Trim nose hairs weekly (Sunday maintenance)
   115â†’- Check ear hair too (yes, you have some)
   116â†’- Use a proper trimmer, not scissors (you WILL cut yourself)
   117â†’
   118â†’**The Psychology:**
   119â†’People rarely notice good grooming here, but they DEFINITELY notice when you neglect it. It's one of those things that can only hurt you, never help. Just eliminate it.
   120â†’
   121â†’Get a trimmer. Use it weekly. This is bare minimum NPC maintenance, and you're not an NPC.`,
   122â†’      products: ['nose_trimmer'],
   123â†’      warnings: [
   124â†’        "Don't use scissors inside your nose",
   125â†’        "Don't pluck nose hairs (infection risk)"
   126â†’      ],
   127â†’    },
   128â†’    {
   129â†’      id: 'weekly-eyebrows',
   130â†’      title: 'Weekly: Eyebrow Maintenance',
   131â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
   132â†’      content: `There's a zone between "unibrow" and "Instagram influencer overplucked" that you're aiming for.
   133â†’
   134â†’**What to Do:**
   135â†’1. **Define the gap** â€” There should be clear separation between brows. Pluck strays between them.
   136â†’2. **Clean the edges** â€” Remove random hairs above and below the brow line.
   137â†’3. **Don't reshape** â€” You're cleaning, not redesigning. Keep your natural brow shape.
   138â†’
   139â†’**What NOT to Do:**
   140â†’- Don't thin them out (thicker brows = more masculine)
   141â†’- Don't create an artificial arch
   142â†’- Don't touch the main body of the brow
   143â†’- Don't wax (too aggressive for maintenance)
   144â†’
   145â†’**The Goal:**
   146â†’Clean and intentional, not "did someone do your eyebrows?" If people can tell you've groomed them, you've gone too far.`,

   158â†’      content: `Whether you're going clean-shaven, stubble, or full beardâ€”it needs to look intentional, not accidental.
   159â†’

   185â†’      content: `Women notice nails immediately. Dirty, long, or bitten nails are an instant credibility killer.

/**
 * General Maintenance Guide
 * Humor Level: High (25%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const maintenanceGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'maintenance',
  slug: 'general-maintenance',
  title: 'General Maintenance',
  subtitle: "The bare minimum that most guys still somehow miss",
  description: "Daily and weekly grooming habits that separate you from the NPCs. Non-negotiable baseline stuff.",
  icon: 'Wrench',
  humorLevel: 'high',
  estimatedReadTime: 10,
  order: 2,
  tags: ['grooming', 'hygiene', 'daily-routine', 'fundamentals'],
  relatedGuides: ['mindset', 'skincare'],
  productIds: [
    'tongue_scraper',
    'electric_toothbrush',
    'philips_oneblade',
    'nose_trimmer',
    'tweezers',
    'aquaphor_lip',
    'cologne_bleu',
  ],
  forumCategory: 'fashion',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'maintenance-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1519085360753-af0119f7cbe7?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Clean, well-groomed appearance',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The NPC Baseline',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `Here's something that might hurt: most guys walking around have absolutely no idea how many basic maintenance things they're neglecting.

Nostril tentacles waving at people mid-conversation. Crusty lips. Unibrow situation developing. Breath that could clear a room.

**Nobody tells you this stuff.** Your friends won't. Your family's given up. Tinder matches just unmatch without explanation.

This guide is the checklist. The bare minimum. The "if you're not doing this, nothing else matters" baseline.

Everything here is simple. Nothing is expensive. No excuses.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'daily-oral',
      title: 'Daily: Oral Hygiene',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `Your breath is out here committing war crimes and you don't even know it.

**The Protocol:**
1. **Brush 2x daily** â€” Electric toothbrush, 2 minutes minimum. If you're using a manual toothbrush in 2024, that's NPC behavior.
2. **Floss daily** â€” Yes, actually. The stuff between your teeth is rotting. Get string floss or a water flosser.
3. **Tongue scrape** â€” This is the secret weapon. 70% of bad breath comes from bacteria on your tongue. Takes 10 seconds, changes everything.

**The Reality Check:**
- You can't smell your own breath
- Everyone's too polite to tell you
- This is actively limiting your social and romantic life
- Fix it now`,
      products: ['tongue_scraper', 'electric_toothbrush'],
      tips: [
        'Scrape tongue BEFORE brushing, not after',
        'Replace toothbrush head every 3 months',
        'Mouthwash is optional but flossing is mandatory'
      ],
      media: [
        {
          id: 'tongue-scraping',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1606107557195-0e29a4b5b4aa?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Oral hygiene and dental care products',
          caption: 'Oral hygiene: brush, floss, scrape',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'daily-lips',
      title: 'Daily: Lip Care',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `Crusty, chapped lips are sabotaging your entire face. The fix costs $5.

**Why This Matters:**
Your lips are one of the first things people notice. Dry, cracked lips read as "doesn't take care of himself" instantly.

**The Fix:**
- Apply lip balm or Aquaphor morning and night
- Reapply after eating or drinking
- At night, use a heavier occlusive (Aquaphor > chapstick)

**Common Mistakes:**
- Licking your lips (makes it worse)
- Flavored lip balms (you'll lick them)
- Forgetting entirely (check your lips right now)

**Pro tip:** Keep one by your bed, one in your pocket, one at your desk. The best lip balm is the one you actually use.`,
      products: ['aquaphor_lip'],
    },
    {
      id: 'weekly-nose-ear',
      title: 'Weekly: Nose & Ear Hair',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `Nostril tentacles waving at people mid-conversation is an instant mog-killer. Nobody's going to tell youâ€”they'll just slowly lose attraction and not know why.

**The Protocol:**
- Trim nose hairs weekly (Sunday maintenance)
- Check ear hair too (yes, you have some)
- Use a proper trimmer, not scissors (you WILL cut yourself)

**The Psychology:**
People rarely notice good grooming here, but they DEFINITELY notice when you neglect it. It's one of those things that can only hurt you, never help. Just eliminate it.

Get a trimmer. Use it weekly. This is bare minimum NPC maintenance, and you're not an NPC.`,
      products: ['nose_trimmer'],
      warnings: [
        "Don't use scissors inside your nose",
        "Don't pluck nose hairs (infection risk)"
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'weekly-eyebrows',
      title: 'Weekly: Eyebrow Maintenance',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `There's a zone between "unibrow" and "Instagram influencer overplucked" that you're aiming for.

**What to Do:**
1. **Define the gap** â€” There should be clear separation between brows. Pluck strays between them.
2. **Clean the edges** â€” Remove random hairs above and below the brow line.
3. **Don't reshape** â€” You're cleaning, not redesigning. Keep your natural brow shape.

**What NOT to Do:**
- Don't thin them out (thicker brows = more masculine)
- Don't create an artificial arch
- Don't touch the main body of the brow
- Don't wax (too aggressive for maintenance)

**The Goal:**
Clean and intentional, not "did someone do your eyebrows?" If people can tell you've groomed them, you've gone too far.`,
      products: ['tweezers'],
      tips: [
        'Pluck after shower when pores are open',
        'Use natural light, bathroom lighting lies',
        'Take a step back every few hairs to check balance'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'weekly-facial-hair',
      title: 'Weekly: Facial Hair Management',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Whether you're going clean-shaven, stubble, or full beardâ€”it needs to look intentional, not accidental.

**Clean-Shaven:**
- Shave every 1-3 days depending on growth
- Use a proper shave cream (not canned foam)
- Shave with the grain first, then against if needed
- Moisturize after

**Stubble:**
- This is the sweet spot for most faces
- Maintain at 1-3mm with a trimmer
- Clean up the neck and cheek lines
- Edge the mustache above the lip line

**Beard:**
- Keep it trimmed and shaped
- Define the neckline (2 fingers above Adam's apple)
- Use beard oil if longer than 1 week growth
- Wash it (yes, like hair)

**The Key:** Whatever style you choose, it should look like a choice, not like you ran out of razors.`,
      products: ['philips_oneblade', 'shaving_cream'],
    },
    {
      id: 'nails',
      title: 'Weekly: Nail Care',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `Women notice nails immediately. Dirty, long, or bitten nails are an instant credibility killer.

**The Standard:**
- Trim weekly
- File rough edges (yes, men can use nail files)
- Clean under nails daily
- Push back cuticles after shower (optional but clean look)

**What You're Avoiding:**
- Nails that extend past fingertips
- Visible dirt under nails
- Ragged, bitten edges
- Hangnails

**No man has ever lost points for having clean, trimmed nails. Many have lost points for the opposite.**`,
      tips: [
        'Cut after shower when nails are softer',
        'Straight across, then round the corners slightly',
        "Keep a nail brush by the sink if you work with your hands"
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'fragrance',
      title: 'Daily: Scent Protocol',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `Stop smelling like your high school gym locker. This ain't Axe bodyspray era anymore.

**The Layers:**
1. **Base** â€” Shower daily with unscented or lightly scented soap
2. **Deodorant** â€” Antiperspirant, applied at night (not morning)
3. **Fragrance** â€” 2-3 sprays MAX of a quality cologne

**Application:**
- Spray on pulse points: wrists, neck, chest
- Don't rub wrists together (breaks down scent)
- Less is moreâ€”you want a "lean in" scent, not an announcement

**Cologne Investment:**
One quality fragrance beats five cheap ones. Bleu de Chanel or similar safe bet. Get compliments, not complaints.

**The Test:** If people can smell you from more than arm's length, you've applied too much.`,
      products: ['cologne_bleu'],
      warnings: [
        'Never spray directly on clothes (stains and alters scent)',
        "Don't reapply throughout the dayâ€”your nose adapts, others can still smell it"
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'hair',
      title: 'Daily: Hair Maintenance',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Your hair is a major factor in your overall look. Neglecting it shows.

**Daily:**
- Style it. Every day. Even if it's a 2-minute routine.
- Use product appropriate to your hair type (matte for thin, pomade for thick)
- Don't touch it throughout the day (transfers oil)

**Every 4-6 Weeks:**
- Get it cut by a real barber
- Find a style that works for your face shape and hair type
- Bring reference photos (they're not just for women)

**Washing:**
- Most guys over-wash (strips natural oils)
- Every 2-3 days is usually enough
- Use conditioner if your hair is longer than 1 inch

**If Thinning:**
- Accept it early or treat it early
- Minoxidil + finasteride (consult a doctor)
- Or just buzz itâ€”a clean shave beats a comb-over every time`,
      tips: [
        'Find one style and master it rather than switching constantly',
        'Take photos of good haircuts to show your barber',
        'Products for hold: wax > pomade > gel > mousse'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'checklist',
      title: 'The Weekly Checklist',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Print this. Put it on your bathroom mirror. No excuses.

**Daily:**
- [ ] Brush teeth (AM + PM)
- [ ] Floss
- [ ] Tongue scrape
- [ ] Apply lip balm
- [ ] Deodorant (night)
- [ ] Style hair
- [ ] Check mirror before leaving

**Weekly (Sunday Reset):**
- [ ] Trim nose/ear hair
- [ ] Eyebrow cleanup
- [ ] Facial hair maintenance
- [ ] Nail trim
- [ ] Deep clean ears

**Monthly:**
- [ ] Haircut
- [ ] Replace toothbrush head
- [ ] Inventory grooming supplies

**This is the baseline.** This is what separates "that guy takes care of himself" from "what's that smell?"

Lock in.`,
    },
  ],
};

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Body Fat Mastery Guide
     3â†’ * Humor Level: Medium-High (20%)
     4â†’ */
     5â†’
     6â†’import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';
     7â†’
     8â†’export const bodyFatGuide: Guide = {
     9â†’  id: 'body-fat',
    10â†’  slug: 'body-fat-mastery',
    11â†’  title: 'Body Fat Mastery',
    12â†’  subtitle: "Your jawline is in there somewhereâ€”go find it",
    13â†’  description: "The single biggest lever for facial aesthetics. Going from 18% to 12% body fat transforms your face.",
    14â†’  icon: 'TrendingDown',
    15â†’  humorLevel: 'medium-high',
    16â†’  estimatedReadTime: 12,
    17â†’  order: 3,
    18â†’  tags: ['body-fat', 'cutting', 'diet', 'facial-aesthetics'],
    19â†’  relatedGuides: ['diet', 'v-taper', 'training'],
    20â†’  productIds: ['food_scale', 'creatine_mono'],
    21â†’  forumCategory: 'face-fat',
    22â†’  heroMedia: {
    23â†’    id: 'bodyfat-hero',
    24â†’    type: 'image',
    25â†’    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1571019613454-1cb2f99b2d8b?w=1200&q=80',
    26â†’    alt: 'Body fat transformation showing facial definition improvement',
    27â†’    placement: 'hero',
    28â†’  },
    29â†’  sections: [
    30â†’    {
    31â†’      id: 'intro',
    32â†’      title: 'The Truth About Body Fat and Your Face',
    33â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
    34â†’      content: `At 18% body fat, you're hoping good lighting saves you. At 11%, you ARE the good lighting.
    35â†’
    36â†’Here's the brutal truth: you can have god-tier bone structure, but if it's buried under a layer of subcutaneous fat, you're frauding yourself out of your own genetics.
    37â†’
    38â†’---
    39â†’
    40â†’## Lean is life. Your jawline knows it.
    41â†’
    42â†’This isn't about being skinny. It's about being lean enough that your facial features actually show:
    43â†’
    44â†’- **Jawline definition** â€” The #1 facial aesthetic improvement
    45â†’- **Cheekbone projection** â€” Creates that hollow, chiseled look
    46â†’- **Under-eye area** â€” No puffy fat pads
    47â†’- **Neck/chin separation** â€” Clean, sharp profile
    48â†’
    49â†’Most guys have never seen their own bone structure because they've never been lean enough.`,
    50â†’      media: [
    51â†’        {
    52â†’          id: 'face-fat-comparison',
    53â†’          type: 'image',
    54â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1583454110551-21f2fa2afe61?w=800&q=80',
    55â†’          alt: 'Lean athletic physique showing definition',
    56â†’          caption: 'The same bone structure at 18% vs 12% body fat',
    57â†’          placement: 'inline',
    58â†’        },
    59â†’      ],
    60â†’    },
    61â†’    {
    62â†’      id: 'bf-ranges',
    63â†’      title: 'Body Fat Percentage Breakdown',
    64â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
    65â†’      content: `Let's be honest about what each range actually looks like:
    66â†’
    67â†’| Body Fat % | What You See | Face Impact |
    68â†’|------------|--------------|-------------|
    69â†’| **20%+** | Soft everywhere, no definition | Buried jaw, soft cheeks, possible double chin |
    70â†’| **17-20%** | Some definition in good lighting | Jaw visible but soft, face holds water |
    71â†’| **14-17%** | Visible abs in good lighting | Decent definition, not optimal |
    72â†’| **12-14%** | Abs visible standing | Good facial definition, jaw pops |
    73â†’| **10-12%** | Clear 6-pack, veins showing | Excellent definition, cheekbones visible |
    74â†’| **8-10%** | Shredded, stage-ready | Maximum facial definition |
    75â†’| **<8%** | Competition lean | Hard to maintain, not realistic long-term |
    76â†’
    77â†’---
    78â†’
    79â†’## The Sweet Spot: 10-14%
    80â†’
    81â†’This is where you're lean enough for facial definition but not so lean that you're constantly hungry, weak, and irritable.
    82â†’
    83â†’Most guys should aim for this range.
    84â†’
    85â†’Below 10% is diminishing returns unless you're competing or doing a photoshoot.`,
    86â†’      tips: [
    87â†’        'Take photos in neutral lighting to assessâ€”bathroom mirror lighting lies',
    88â†’        'Measure waist circumference as a simple tracking metric',
    89â†’        'DEXA scans are the gold standard for accuracy',
    90â†’      ],
    91â†’      media: [
    92â†’        {
    93â†’          id: 'bf-visual-guide',
    94â†’          type: 'image',
    95â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1534438327276-14e5300c3a48?w=800&q=80',
    96â†’          alt: 'Visual guide showing different body fat percentages',
    97â†’          caption: 'Reference guide for estimating your body fat percentage',
    98â†’          placement: 'inline',
    99â†’        },
   100â†’      ],
   101â†’    },
   102â†’    {
   103â†’      id: 'where-fat-stores',
   104â†’      title: 'Where Fat Stores (And Why Your Face Suffers)',
   105â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
   106â†’      content: `Fat distribution is genetic, but there's a general pattern:
   107â†’
   108â†’---
   109â†’
   110â†’## First to Store (Last to Lose)
   111â†’
   112â†’These are the stubborn areas:
   113â†’
   114â†’- Lower belly
   115â†’- Love handles
   116â†’- Lower back
   117â†’- **Face (buccal area, under chin)**
   118â†’
   119â†’## Last to Store (First to Lose)
   120â†’
   121â†’These lean out quickly:
   122â†’
   123â†’- Arms
   124â†’- Upper chest
   125â†’- Calves
   126â†’
   127â†’---
   128â†’
   129â†’## What This Means
   130â†’
   131â†’Your face is often one of the **LAST** places to lean out.
   132â†’
   133â†’This is why guys at 18% think *"I'm not even that fat"* while their jaw is still buried.
   134â†’
   135â†’## The Face Tax
   136â†’
   137â†’If you carry fat in your face (many people do), you might need to get leaner than average to see facial definition.
   138â†’
   139â†’Someone might have a visible 6-pack at 14%, but their face doesn't pop until 11%.
   140â†’
   141â†’It's not fair. It's genetics. Work with it.`,
   142â†’      media: [
   143â†’        {
   144â†’          id: 'fat-distribution',
   145â†’          type: 'image',
   146â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1571019614242-c5c5dee9f50b?w=800&q=80',
   147â†’          alt: 'Athlete with lean physique',
   148â†’          caption: 'Common fat storage patterns - face fat is often the last to go',
   149â†’          placement: 'inline',
   150â†’        },
   151â†’      ],
   152â†’    },
   153â†’    {
   154â†’      id: 'measuring',
   155â†’      title: 'How to Actually Measure Body Fat',
   156â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   157â†’      content: `Most methods are garbage. Here's the hierarchy:
   158â†’

/**
 * Body Fat Mastery Guide

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const bodyFatGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'body-fat',
  slug: 'body-fat-mastery',
  title: 'Body Fat Mastery',
  subtitle: "Your jawline is in there somewhereâ€”go find it",
  description: "The single biggest lever for facial aesthetics. Going from 18% to 12% body fat transforms your face.",
  icon: 'TrendingDown',
  humorLevel: 'medium-high',

    alt: 'Body fat transformation showing facial definition improvement',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Truth About Body Fat and Your Face',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `At 18% body fat, you're hoping good lighting saves you. At 11%, you ARE the good lighting.

Here's the brutal truth: you can have god-tier bone structure, but if it's buried under a layer of subcutaneous fat, you're frauding yourself out of your own genetics.

---

## Lean is life. Your jawline knows it.

This isn't about being skinny. It's about being lean enough that your facial features actually show:

- **Jawline definition** â€” The #1 facial aesthetic improvement
- **Cheekbone projection** â€” Creates that hollow, chiseled look
- **Under-eye area** â€” No puffy fat pads
- **Neck/chin separation** â€” Clean, sharp profile

Most guys have never seen their own bone structure because they've never been lean enough.`,
      media: [
        {
          id: 'face-fat-comparison',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1583454110551-21f2fa2afe61?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Lean athletic physique showing definition',
          caption: 'The same bone structure at 18% vs 12% body fat',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'bf-ranges',
      title: 'Body Fat Percentage Breakdown',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Let's be honest about what each range actually looks like:

| Body Fat % | What You See | Face Impact |
|------------|--------------|-------------|
| **20%+** | Soft everywhere, no definition | Buried jaw, soft cheeks, possible double chin |
| **17-20%** | Some definition in good lighting | Jaw visible but soft, face holds water |
| **14-17%** | Visible abs in good lighting | Decent definition, not optimal |
| **12-14%** | Abs visible standing | Good facial definition, jaw pops |
| **10-12%** | Clear 6-pack, veins showing | Excellent definition, cheekbones visible |
| **8-10%** | Shredded, stage-ready | Maximum facial definition |
| **<8%** | Competition lean | Hard to maintain, not realistic long-term |

---

## The Sweet Spot: 10-14%

This is where you're lean enough for facial definition but not so lean that you're constantly hungry, weak, and irritable.

Most guys should aim for this range.

Below 10% is diminishing returns unless you're competing or doing a photoshoot.`,
      tips: [
        'Take photos in neutral lighting to assessâ€”bathroom mirror lighting lies',
        'Measure waist circumference as a simple tracking metric',
        'DEXA scans are the gold standard for accuracy',
      ],
      media: [
        {
          id: 'bf-visual-guide',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1534438327276-14e5300c3a48?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Visual guide showing different body fat percentages',
          caption: 'Reference guide for estimating your body fat percentage',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'where-fat-stores',
      title: 'Where Fat Stores (And Why Your Face Suffers)',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `Fat distribution is genetic, but there's a general pattern:

---

## First to Store (Last to Lose)

These are the stubborn areas:

- Lower belly
- Love handles
- Lower back
- **Face (buccal area, under chin)**

## Last to Store (First to Lose)

These lean out quickly:

- Arms
- Upper chest
- Calves

---

## What This Means

Your face is often one of the **LAST** places to lean out.

This is why guys at 18% think *"I'm not even that fat"* while their jaw is still buried.

## The Face Tax

If you carry fat in your face (many people do), you might need to get leaner than average to see facial definition.

Someone might have a visible 6-pack at 14%, but their face doesn't pop until 11%.

It's not fair. It's genetics. Work with it.`,
      media: [
        {
          id: 'fat-distribution',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1571019614242-c5c5dee9f50b?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Athlete with lean physique',
          caption: 'Common fat storage patterns - face fat is often the last to go',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'measuring',
      title: 'How to Actually Measure Body Fat',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Most methods are garbage. Here's the hierarchy:

---

## Tier 1: DEXA Scan (Most Accurate)

- $50-150 at clinics
- Tells you exactly where fat is distributed
- Worth getting once to establish baseline

## Tier 2: Calipers (Decent If Done Right)

- $15 for calipers
- 7-site measurement protocol
- Requires practice and consistency
- Â±3% error margin

## Tier 3: Navy Method (Free, Okay)

- Uses neck and waist measurements
- Formula-based estimate
- Better than nothing

## Tier 4: Bioelectrical Impedance (Mostly Useless)

- Those scales and gym machines
- Varies wildly based on hydration
- Can be off by 5-10%
- Only useful for tracking trends, not absolute numbers

## Tier 5: Mirror + Photos (Subjective But Real)

- Compare to reference photos at known body fat %
- Track progress over time
- Lighting consistent, same time of day

---

**Recommendation:** Get a DEXA scan once, then track via photos and waist measurement.`,
      products: ['food_scale'],
    },
    {
      id: 'the-math',
      title: 'The Fat Loss Equation',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `This is simple math. Not easy, but simple.

---

## The Formula

> **Calories In < Calories Out = Fat Loss**

That's it. There's no metabolic magic. No foods that "burn fat." No supplements that override physics.

---

## Setting Your Deficit

1. Calculate maintenance calories (TDEE)
2. Subtract 300-500 calories
3. Adjust based on results

## Rate of Loss

| Goal | Rate | Weekly Deficit |
|------|------|----------------|
| **Sustainable** | 0.5-1% of bodyweight/week | 300-500 cal/day |
| **Aggressive** | 1-1.5% of bodyweight/week | 500-750 cal/day |
| **Too Fast** | >1.5% of bodyweight/week | Muscle loss risk |

---

## For a 180lb guy:

- **Target:** 0.9-1.8 lbs per week
- **Deficit:** 450-900 calories daily
- **Timeline:** 10 lbs of fat takes 5-10 weeks minimum

**The Reality:** Most guys try to cut too fast, lose muscle, feel like death, and rebound. Don't be that guy.`,
      tips: [
        '500 calorie deficit = ~1 lb fat loss per week',
        'Weigh daily, average weekly (weight fluctuates)',
        "If you're not losing, you're eating more than you think",
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'protein-priority',
      title: 'Protein: The Non-Negotiable',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `When cutting, protein is king. Everything else is secondary.

---

## Why Protein Matters

- **Preserves muscle mass** during deficit
- **Most satiating** macronutrient (keeps you full)
- **Highest thermic effect** (burns calories to digest)
- **Prevents** the "skinny fat" look

## How Much

| Bodyweight | Daily Protein Target |
|------------|---------------------|
| 150 lbs | 120-150g |
| 180 lbs | 144-180g |
| 200 lbs | 160-200g |
| 220 lbs | 176-220g |

Yes, this seems like a lot. Yes, it's necessary.

---

## Example Day (180g protein)

| Meal | Foods | Protein |
|------|-------|---------|
| **Breakfast** | 4 eggs + greek yogurt | 40g |
| **Lunch** | 8oz chicken breast + cottage cheese | 60g |
| **Dinner** | 8oz salmon + protein shake | 60g |
| **Snack** | Protein bar | 20g |
| **TOTAL** | | **180g** |

If you're consistently under on protein, you're going to lose muscle and end up looking worse at the same weight.`,
      products: ['creatine_mono'],
    },
    {
      id: 'water-and-bloat',
      title: 'Water Weight and Facial Bloat',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `You're not drinking enough water. Yes, you.

Your face is literally retaining fluid to compensate.

---

## The Paradox

> Drink **MORE** water to hold **LESS** water.

Your body retains fluid when dehydrated.

## The Protocol

| Bodyweight | Daily Water Target |
|------------|-------------------|
| 150 lbs | 75 oz (2.2L) |
| 180 lbs | 90 oz (2.7L) |
| 200 lbs | 100 oz (3L) |
| 220 lbs | 110 oz (3.3L) |

Add more if training or sweating.

---

## What Causes Facial Bloat

| Cause | Effect | Fix |
|-------|--------|-----|
| **Sodium** | High salt = water retention | Keep moderate, not zero |
| **Alcohol** | Dehydrates, then overcompensates | Limit or eliminate |
| **Carbs** | Each gram stores 3-4g of water | Expected, not bad |
| **Sleep deprivation** | Cortisol = water retention | Get 7-8 hours |
| **Dehydration** | Counter-intuitive but true | Drink more water |

---

## The Morning Difference

Ever notice you look leaner in the morning?

You're slightly dehydrated after 8 hours without water. This is why fighters cut water weightâ€”it makes a visible difference.

For consistent leanness, stay consistently hydrated and keep sodium moderate.`,
      products: ['water_jug'],
      tips: [
        'Drink a full glass of water immediately upon waking',
        'Cut sodium 24-48 hours before photos for temporary tightness',
        "Alcohol is the worst for next-day face bloat",
      ],
      media: [
        {
          id: 'bloat-comparison',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1548690312-e3b507d8c110?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Healthy hydration and fitness',
          caption: 'Same person: bloated vs properly hydrated',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'timeline',
      title: 'Realistic Cutting Timeline',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Let's set realistic expectations:

---

## Starting Point: 20% Body Fat (180lb guy)

- **Goal:** 12% body fat
- **Fat to lose:** ~15 lbs
- **Timeline:** 10-15 weeks (doing it right)

---

## Week by Week Progress

| Weeks | What Happens | What You See |
|-------|--------------|--------------|
| **1-2** | Water weight drops | Scale moves fast, exciting |
| **3-6** | Steady fat loss | Starting to see changes |
| **7-10** | Face starts tightening | Jaw appearing, cheekbones hint |
| **11-15** | Final stubborn fat burns | Face pops, transformation complete |

---

## The Trap

Weeks 6-10 are where most guys quit.

Scale slows, you don't see daily changes, and pizza sounds really good.

## The Reality

> Fat loss in the face often happens in the **final phase**.

You might look the same for weeks, then suddenly *"damn, there's my jawline."*

Be patient. Trust the deficit. Don't quit in the middle of the transformation.`,
      warnings: [
        "Don't cut harder because the scale slowedâ€”you'll lose muscle",
        'Take weekly photos in the same conditions for accurate comparison',
      ],
      media: [
        {
          id: 'timeline-progress',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1517836357463-d25dfeac3438?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Visual timeline of fitness progress',
          caption: '12-week transformation: patience is key',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'maintaining',
      title: 'Maintaining Lean (The Hard Part)',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Getting lean is one thing. Staying lean is another.

---

## Why Maintenance Is Hard

- Hunger hormones increase after cutting
- Metabolism adapts (slightly) to lower calories
- One vacation can undo weeks of progress
- Life happens

## The Strategy

1. **Reverse diet** â€” Slowly increase calories after cutting
2. **Stay active** â€” NEAT (daily movement) matters as much as gym
3. **Keep tracking** â€” At least loosely, forever
4. **Set a ceiling** â€” "I never go above 15%" as a rule

---

## The Buffer Zone

Cutting to 11% then maintaining at 13% is easier than trying to stay at 11% year-round.

Give yourself a 2-3% buffer for life fluctuations.

## The Long Game

> Most guys yo-yo because they treat cutting as temporary.

Make leanness part of your identity, not a phase.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'common-mistakes',
      title: 'Common Cutting Mistakes',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `Don't be this guy:

---

## Mistake 1: Cutting Too Fast

*"I'll just eat 1200 calories and do 2 hours of cardio."*

**Result:** Lose muscle, crash metabolism, binge, end up fatter than before.

---

## Mistake 2: Ignoring Protein

*"I'm just not going to eat much."*

**Result:** Skinny-fat physique, lost the muscle, kept the face fat.

---

## Mistake 3: Weekend Cheats

*"I was good all week!"*

**Result:** 3500 calorie surplus Saturday-Sunday wipes out the weekly deficit.

---

## Mistake 4: Drinking Calories

*"But it's just juice/beer/coffee drinks."*

**Result:** 500+ invisible calories daily, no satiety, confused why scale won't move.

---

## Mistake 5: No Resistance Training

*"I just need to do cardio to lose weight."*

**Result:** Lost 20 lbsâ€”15 of muscle. Now you're a smaller, softer version of yourself.

---

## Mistake 6: Obsessing Over the Scale

*"I gained 2 lbs overnight, I'm done!"*

**Result:** Water fluctuation caused a mental breakdown. Real progress lost in the noise.

---

Avoid these and you're ahead of 90% of people trying to cut.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'action-plan',
      title: 'Your Action Plan',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Here's exactly what to do:

---

## Step 1: Establish Baseline

- Get a DEXA scan or estimate body fat from photos
- Calculate TDEE (plenty of calculators online)
- Take photos in consistent lighting

## Step 2: Set Up Tracking

- Download a calorie tracking app
- Get a food scale (non-negotiable for accuracy)
- Set protein and calorie targets

## Step 3: Start the Cut

- 300-500 calorie deficit
- Hit protein daily (0.8-1g/lb)
- Lift weights 3-4x per week (don't just do cardio)

## Step 4: Monitor and Adjust

- Weigh daily, average weekly
- If not losing after 2 weeks, reduce by 100-200 calories
- Take weekly photos in same conditions

## Step 5: Be Patient

- Expect 10-15 weeks for a significant cut
- Facial changes come lastâ€”don't quit early
- Adjust timeline based on actual progress

---

## Your face will thank you. Lock in.`,
      products: ['food_scale'],
    },
  ],
};

    53â†’

   133â†’

   142â†’      tips: [

   145â†’        'Scapula should moveâ€”pinch at top, protract at bottom'
   146â†’      ],
   147â†’    },
   148â†’    {
   149â†’      id: 'rear-delts',
   150â†’      title: 'Rear Delt Training',
   151â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   152â†’      content: `Rear delts are invisible in the mirror but critical for:

   157â†’**The Problem:**

   160â†’**The Exercises:**

   163â†’3. **Bent Over Rear Delt Raises** â€” Requires strict form
   164â†’4. **Cable Rear Delt Flies** â€” Constant tension variation
   165â†’

   174â†’    },
   175â†’    {
   176â†’      id: 'the-waist',
   177â†’      title: 'Keeping the Waist Tight',
   178â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
   179â†’      content: `The other half of the V-taper equation: a small waist. You can have massive shoulders, but if your waist is wide, the ratio is lost.
   180â†’
   181â†’**What Widens the Waist:**

   212â†’      content: `Here's how to prioritize V-taper muscles in your weekly routine:

   220â†’
   221â†’**Day 2: Pull (Lat Width Focus)**
   222â†’- Pull-Ups: 4x8-12
   223â†’- Barbell Rows: 4x8-10
   224â†’- Lat Pulldowns: 3x10-12
   225â†’- Face Pulls: 4x15-20
   226â†’- Rear Delt Flies: 3x15-20
   227â†’
   228â†’**Day 3: Legs**
   229â†’- Squats: 4x6-8

   231â†’- Leg Press: 3x12-15
   232â†’- Leg Curls: 3x12-15
   233â†’- Calf Raises: 4x15-20
   234â†’
   235â†’**Day 4: Push (Chest Focus)**
   236â†’- Bench Press: 4x6-8
   237â†’- Incline Press: 3x10-12
   238â†’- Lateral Raises: 4x15-20 (yes, again)
   239â†’- Cable Flies: 3x12-15
   240â†’- Tricep Work: 3x10-12
   241â†’
   242â†’**Day 5: Pull (Thickness Focus)**
   243â†’- Deadlifts: 3x5
   244â†’- Dumbbell Rows: 4x10-12
   245â†’- Seated Cable Rows: 3x10-12
   246â†’- Face Pulls: 4x15-20
   247â†’- Rear Delt Work: 3x15-20
   248â†’
   249â†’**Key Takeaway:**
   250â†’Notice how lateral raises appear twice and rear delts are hit 4x per week. This is intentionalâ€”these muscles need frequency.`,
   251â†’    },
   252â†’    {
   253â†’      id: 'timeline',
   254â†’      title: 'Realistic Development Timeline',
   255â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   256â†’      content: `Building a V-taper takes time. Here's what to expect:
   257â†’
   258â†’**Month 1-3: Foundation**
   259â†’- Learning proper form
   260â†’- Building mind-muscle connection
   261â†’- Initial strength gains
   262â†’- Minimal visual changes
   263â†’
   264â†’**Month 4-6: Visible Progress**
   265â†’- Shoulders starting to cap
   266â†’- Lats have some width when flexed
   267â†’- Clothes fitting different
   268â†’- Others might notice
   269â†’
   270â†’**Month 7-12: Real Development**
   271â†’- Clear V-taper in the mirror
   272â†’- Shoulders visibly wider than waist
   273â†’- Back has width and thickness
   274â†’- Significant visual improvement
   275â†’
   276â†’**Year 2+: Advanced Development**
   277â†’- Refinement and proportion
   278â†’- 3D deltoids
   279â†’- Impressive width unflexed
   280â†’- "Do you work out?" becomes constant
   281â†’
   282â†’**The Reality:**
   283â†’Most guys quit before month 6. The visual payoff happens later than you want. The guys with great V-tapers have been training consistently for 2-5+ years.
   284â†’
   285â†’Patience. Consistency. Progressive overload. That's the formula.`,
   286â†’      products: ['creatine_mono'],
   287â†’    },
   288â†’    {
   289â†’      id: 'common-mistakes',
   290â†’      title: 'Common V-Taper Mistakes',
   291â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
   292â†’      content: `Don't sabotage your width:
   293â†’
   294â†’**Mistake 1: Neglecting Side Delts**
   295â†’Front delts get hit in every press. Side delts don't. If you're not doing direct lateral work, you're not building width.
   296â†’
   297â†’**Mistake 2: Going Too Heavy on Lateral Raises**
   298â†’Ego lifting with 40lb dumbbells and full body momentum. Your side delts never feel it. Drop to 15lbs and actually control the movement.
   299â†’
   300â†’**Mistake 3: All Chest, No Back**
   301â†’Mirror muscles syndrome. You can't see your back, so you don't train it. Result: narrow, hunched, imbalanced.
   302â†’
   303â†’**Mistake 4: Heavy Oblique Work**
   304â†’Weighted side bends, wood chops with too much resistance. Congrats, you just widened your waist.
   305â†’
   306â†’**Mistake 5: Bulking Too Hard**
   307â†’"I need to eat big to get big." Now your waist is 36 inches and your V-taper is gone. Stay relatively lean while building.
   308â†’
   309â†’**Mistake 6: Not Training Rear Delts**
   310â†’Shoulders look flat from the side. Rotator cuff injuries from pressing imbalance. Easily prevented, commonly neglected.`,
   311â†’    },
   312â†’    {
   313â†’      id: 'action-steps',
   314â†’      title: 'Your Action Plan',
   315â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   316â†’      content: `Start building your V-taper today:
   317â†’
   318â†’**Immediate Actions:**
   319â†’1. Add lateral raises to every upper body day (minimum 3x per week)
   320â†’2. Add face pulls for rear delts (minimum 2x per week)
   321â†’3. Prioritize pull-ups or lat pulldowns for width
   322â†’
   323â†’**Weekly Volume Targets:**
   324â†’- Side Delts: 12-16 sets per week
   325â†’- Rear Delts: 8-12 sets per week
   326â†’- Lats: 10-15 sets per week (vertical + horizontal)
   327â†’
   328â†’**Waist Management:**
   329â†’- Practice stomach vacuums daily
   330â†’- Avoid heavy weighted oblique work
   331â†’- Stay in the 10-14% body fat range
   332â†’
   333â†’**Tracking:**
   334â†’- Measure shoulder and waist circumference monthly
   335â†’- Take progress photos (back and side views)
   336â†’- Track your lifting numbers for progressive overload
   337â†’
   338â†’**Supplementation:**
   339â†’- Creatine for strength and fullness
   340â†’- Protein for muscle building
   341â†’- That's itâ€”no magic pills for width
   342â†’
   343â†’The V-taper is earned, not given. Start building it now.`,
   344â†’      products: ['creatine_mono', 'collagen_peptides'],
   345â†’    },
   346â†’  ],
   347â†’};
   348â†’

<system-reminder>

/**
 * V-Taper Building Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const vTaperGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'v-taper',
  slug: 'v-taper-building',

  subtitle: "Shoulder-to-waist ratio that makes shirts fit different",
  description: "Build the classic V-shape physique that signals athleticism and dominance. Wide shoulders, narrow waist.",
  icon: 'Dumbbell',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 10,
  order: 4,
  tags: ['physique', 'shoulders', 'back', 'v-taper', 'aesthetics'],
  relatedGuides: ['body-fat', 'training', 'diet'],
  productIds: ['creatine_mono', 'omega3_fish_oil', 'collagen_peptides'],

    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'What Is the V-Taper?',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `The V-taper is the ratio between your shoulder width and your waist circumference. It's one of the most universally attractive physical traits and signals:
- Athleticism
- Testosterone
- Physical capability

**The Golden Ratio:**
Your shoulder circumference should be roughly 1.618x your waist circumference. This is the mathematical proportion that's been considered ideal since ancient Greece.

**The Reality:**
Most guys have the oppositeâ€”narrow shoulders and wide waists. This is what sitting at a desk 8 hours a day produces.

**The Fix:**
Build the shoulders and lats wide. Keep the waist narrow. Simple concept, requires consistent work.`,
    },
    {

4. **Upper Chest**

   - Add thickness and presence

**Programming:**

- Ego lifting on lateral raises is the biggest mistake

   334â†’      content: `## The Classic
   335â†’
   336â†’| Day | Focus |
   337â†’|-----|-------|
   338â†’| Monday | Chest |
   339â†’| Tuesday | Back |
   340â†’| Wednesday | Shoulders |
   341â†’| Thursday | Arms |
   342â†’| Friday | Legs |
   343â†’
   344â†’---
   345â†’
   346â†’## The Truth
   347â†’
   348â†’The bro split is often mocked as "suboptimal" because each muscle only gets hit once per week.
   349â†’
   350â†’Science says 2x per week frequency is better for hypertrophy.
   351â†’
   352â†’---
   353â†’
   354â†’## But Here's the Thing
   355â†’
   356â†’If you've been training for years and want maximum volume per session, or if it's the only split you'll stick to consistently, it can still work.
   357â†’
   358â†’### When It Makes Sense
   359â†’
   360â†’- Advanced lifters who need 15-20+ sets per muscle
   361â†’- Those who enjoy destroying one muscle group per session
   362â†’- People who've tried other splits and prefer this
   363â†’
   364â†’### When It Doesn't
   365â†’
   366â†’- Beginners (you don't need that much volume)
   367â†’- People who miss gym days frequently
   368â†’- Natural lifters who benefit from frequency
   369â†’
   370â†’---
   371â†’
   372â†’## The Compromise
   373â†’
   374â†’If you like the bro split style, consider hitting each muscle 1.5x per week:
   375â†’
   376â†’- Chest + Triceps
   377â†’- Back + Biceps
   378â†’- Shoulders + Legs (light)
   379â†’- Arms + Rear Delts
   380â†’- Legs (heavy)`,
   381â†’    },
   382â†’    {
   383â†’      id: 'exercise-selection',
   384â†’      title: 'Choosing the Right Exercises',
   385â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   386â†’      content: `Not all exercises are equal. Here's how to prioritize:
   387â†’
   388â†’---
   389â†’
   390â†’## Tier 1: Compound Movements (Build Your Foundation)
   391â†’
   392â†’These should make up 60-70% of your training:
   393â†’
   394â†’| Movement Pattern | Exercises |
   395â†’|------------------|-----------|
   396â†’| **Squat** | Back Squat, Front Squat, Goblet Squat |
   397â†’| **Hinge** | Deadlift, RDL, Good Morning |
   398â†’| **Horizontal Push** | Bench Press, DB Press, Push-Ups |
   399â†’| **Horizontal Pull** | Barbell Row, DB Row, Cable Row |
   400â†’| **Vertical Push** | Overhead Press, DB Shoulder Press |
   401â†’| **Vertical Pull** | Pull-Ups, Lat Pulldown, Chin-Ups |
   402â†’
   403â†’---
   404â†’
   405â†’## Tier 2: Compound Accessories
   406â†’
   407â†’- Lunges, leg press, RDLs
   408â†’- Dips, incline press
   409â†’- Face pulls, rear delt work
   410â†’- Curl and tricep compound movements
   411â†’
   412â†’## Tier 3: Isolation (Target Weaknesses)
   413â†’
   414â†’- Lateral raises (for V-taper)
   415â†’- Bicep curls (for arm peak)
   416â†’- Tricep extensions (for arm size)
   417â†’- Leg curls/extensions (for leg detail)
   418â†’- Calf raises (for calf size)
   419â†’
   420â†’---
   421â†’
   422â†’> **The Mistake:** Building your routine around cable machines and isolation exercises. These are supplements to compounds, not replacements.`,
   423â†’      tips: [
   424â†’        'Master form on compounds before going heavy',
   425â†’        'Isolations are for lagging body parts',
   426â†’        'If short on time, cut isolations first, never compounds',
   427â†’      ],
   428â†’      media: [
   429â†’        {
   430â†’          id: 'row-form',
   431â†’          type: 'image',
   432â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1603287681836-b174ce5074c2?w=800&q=80',
   433â†’          alt: 'Athlete performing back exercises',
   434â†’          caption: 'Barbell Row: 45-degree torso, pull to lower chest',
   435â†’          placement: 'inline',
   436â†’        },
   437â†’      ],
   438â†’    },
   439â†’    {
   440â†’      id: 'rep-ranges',
   441â†’      title: 'Rep Ranges and What They Do',
   442â†’      humorLevel: 'low',
   443â†’      content: `Different rep ranges serve different purposes:
   444â†’
   445â†’---
   446â†’
   447â†’## The Ranges
   448â†’
   449â†’| Reps | Focus | Best For |
   450â†’|------|-------|----------|
   451â†’| **1-5** | Strength | Compounds (squat, bench, deadlift) |
   452â†’| **6-12** | Hypertrophy | Most trainingâ€”the sweet spot |
   453â†’| **12-20+** | Metabolic/Pump | Small muscles, finishing sets |
   454â†’
   455â†’---
   456â†’
   457â†’## The Reality
   458â†’
   459â†’Muscles grow across all rep ranges when taken close to failure.
   460â†’
   461â†’The "6-12 for hypertrophy" rule is a guideline, not a law.
   462â†’
   463â†’## Practical Application
   464â†’
   465â†’| Exercise Type | Rep Range |
   466â†’|---------------|-----------|
   467â†’| **Compounds** | 5-10 reps |
   468â†’| **Secondary compounds** | 8-12 reps |
   469â†’| **Isolations** | 10-20 reps |
   470â†’
   471â†’Mix it up within these guidelines for variety.`,
   472â†’    },
   473â†’    {
   474â†’      id: 'progression',
   475â†’      title: 'How to Progress',
   476â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   477â†’      content: `If you're not progressing, you're not growing. Here's how to ensure constant improvement:
   478â†’
   479â†’---
   480â†’
   481â†’## Method 1: Linear Progression (Beginners)
   482â†’
   483â†’Add weight every session:
   484â†’
   485â†’| Week | Bench Press |
   486â†’|------|-------------|
   487â†’| 1 | 135 x 3x8 |
   488â†’| 2 | 140 x 3x8 |
   489â†’| 3 | 145 x 3x8 |
   490â†’| 4 | 150 x 3x8 |
   491â†’
   492â†’Continue until you stall.
   493â†’
   494â†’---
   495â†’
   496â†’## Method 2: Double Progression (Intermediate)
   497â†’
   498â†’Work within a rep range, increase weight when you hit the top:
   499â†’
   500â†’| Week | Weight x Sets x Reps |
   501â†’|------|---------------------|
   502â†’| 1 | 185 x 3x8 |
   503â†’| 2 | 185 x 3x9 |
   504â†’| 3 | 185 x 3x10 |
   505â†’| 4 | 190 x 3x8 (restart) |
   506â†’
   507â†’---
   508â†’
   509â†’## Method 3: Volume Progression (Advanced)
   510â†’
   511â†’Keep weight same, add sets:
   512â†’
   513â†’| Week | Sets |
   514â†’|------|------|
   515â†’| 1 | 3 sets |
   516â†’| 2 | 4 sets |
   517â†’| 3 | 5 sets |
   518â†’| 4 | Deload |
   519â†’
   520â†’---
   521â†’
   522â†’## When You Stall
   523â†’
   524â†’1. Check sleep and nutrition first
   525â†’2. Deload (reduce volume/intensity for 1 week)
   526â†’3. Try a different rep range or exercise variation
   527â†’4. Accept that progress slows after the beginner phase`,
   528â†’    },
   529â†’    {
   530â†’      id: 'choosing-split',
   531â†’      title: 'Which Split Should You Choose?',
   532â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   533â†’      content: `The best split is the one you'll actually do consistently. Here's the decision tree:
   534â†’
   535â†’---
   536â†’
   537â†’## How many days can you REALISTICALLY train per week?
   538â†’
   539â†’| Days Available | Recommended Split |
   540â†’|----------------|-------------------|
   541â†’| **3 Days** | Full Body |
   542â†’| **4 Days** | Upper/Lower |
   543â†’| **5 Days** | Upper/Lower/Upper/Lower/Full or modified PPL |
   544â†’| **6 Days** | PPL (Push/Pull/Legs 2x) |
   545â†’
   546â†’---
   547â†’
   548â†’## Quick Guide
   549â†’
   550â†’### 3 Days â†’ Full Body
   551â†’- Best bang for buck with limited time
   552â†’- Perfect for beginners
   553â†’
   554â†’### 4 Days â†’ Upper/Lower
   555â†’- Great balance of volume and recovery
   556â†’- Good for most intermediates
   557â†’
   558â†’### 5 Days â†’ Flexible
   559â†’- More flexibility
   560â†’- Good volume and frequency
   561â†’
   562â†’### 6 Days â†’ PPL
   563â†’- Maximum volume and frequency
   564â†’- Requires excellent recovery
   565â†’- Advanced or great genetics
   566â†’
   567â†’---
   568â†’
   569â†’> **Be Honest With Yourself:** If you're planning a 6-day split but realistically make it 3-4 times per week, you're doing yourself a disservice. A 4-day split done consistently beats a 6-day split done randomly.`,
   570â†’      products: ['creatine_mono'],
   571â†’    },
   572â†’    {
   573â†’      id: 'action-plan',
   574â†’      title: 'Your Action Plan',
   575â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   576â†’      content: `Here's what to do:
   577â†’
   578â†’---
   579â†’
   580â†’## Step 1: Choose Your Split
   581â†’
   582â†’Based on your available training days and experience level. When in doubt, go with fewer days and build up.
   583â†’
   584â†’## Step 2: Write It Down
   585â†’
   586â†’Physically write or type your routine. Every exercise, sets, reps, and rest periods.
   587â†’
   588â†’## Step 3: Track Every Workout
   589â†’
   590â†’Use an app or notebook. Record weight x reps for every set.
   591â†’
   592â†’## Step 4: Progress Each Session
   593â†’
   594â†’Add weight, reps, or sets whenever possible. If you completed all prescribed reps, increase something next time.
   595â†’
   596â†’## Step 5: Stick With It
   597â†’
   598â†’**Minimum 8-12 weeks before changing programs.**
   599â†’
   600â†’Program hopping is one of the biggest gains killers.
   601â†’
   602â†’## Step 6: Deload When Needed
   603â†’
   604â†’Every 4-6 weeks, take a lighter week. This isn't weaknessâ€”it's smart programming.
   605â†’
   606â†’---
   607â†’
   608â†’> The gym is simple: show up, lift more than last time, recover, repeat. Don't overcomplicate it.`,
   609â†’    },
   610â†’  ],
   611â†’};
   612â†’
